original_title: Bronx: Morris Park Avenue - Bronxdale Avenue
text:
Morris Park Ave., east from Bronxdale Ave., showing laborers laying out trolley line tracks on the part of the thoroughfare that extends to Williamsbridge Road. The avenue, between the aforementioned two points was cut through the former Morris Park Race Track in connection with its sale by Joseph P. Day and J. Clarence Davies in the summer of 1913. For additional data see the "New York Times" of April 27, June 15, and June 22, 1913.

Spring 1913.

original_title: Bronx: Bronxdale Avenue - Morris Park Avenue
text:
Bronxdale Avenue, east side, south from Morris Park to Van Nest Avenues. The dwellings, the rears of which are shown, front on Fowler Avenue. The sign on the corner reads:

St. Clare's Church
Pilgrimages
To St. Anthony's Shrine
Nanuette, N. Y.
Sunday, July 21st
To Holy Land of America
Washington, D. C.
Labor Day Week End
Aug. 31st to Sept. 2nd
Reservations can be made at Rectory.

June 22, 1940

P. L. Sperr
